intro: Borreria latifolia f. minor, commonly known as the narrow-leaved borreria, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking drought-tolerant plants.
